general.apply: You can apply for admission through our online portal at admissions.university.edu. The application process involves: 1. Online registration, 2. Document upload, 3. Application fee payment, 4. Submission of online form.
general.requirements: General admission requirements include: High school diploma or equivalent, Minimum GPA of 2.5, Standardized test scores (SAT/ACT), English proficiency test (TOEFL/IELTS for international students), Letters of recommendation, Personal statement.
general.deadlines: Important deadlines for Fall 2024: Early Decision - November 1, 2023, Regular Decision - January 15, 2024, Financial Aid - March 1, 2024. For Spring 2024: November 15, 2023.

documents.required: Required documents: 1. Completed application form, 2. Official transcripts, 3. Test scores (SAT/ACT), 4. English proficiency scores, 5. 2-3 letters of recommendation, 6. Personal statement/Essay, 7. Resume/CV, 8. Passport copy (international students).
documents.transcripts: Official transcripts from all previous educational institutions must be sent directly to the admissions office. Unofficial transcripts can be uploaded for initial review.
documents.recommendation: Letters of recommendation should be from teachers, counselors, or employers who can speak to your academic abilities and character.

eligibility.undergraduate: Undergraduate eligibility: High school graduate or equivalent, Minimum 2.5 GPA, SAT minimum 1000 or ACT composite 20, TOEFL 80 iBT or IELTS 6.5 for international students.
eligibility.graduate: Graduate eligibility: Bachelor's degree from accredited institution, Minimum 3.0 GPA, GRE/GMAT scores (program dependent), TOEFL 90 iBT or IELTS 7.0 for international students.
eligibility.international: International students must have: Valid passport, Student visa eligibility, English proficiency scores, Financial documentation, Translated and evaluated transcripts.

courses.undergraduate: Undergraduate programs: Computer Science, Business Administration, Psychology, Biology, Engineering, English Literature, Economics, Political Science, Art History, Mathematics.
courses.graduate: Graduate programs: MBA, MS in Computer Science, MA in Psychology, MS in Engineering, MPH in Public Health, MFA in Creative Writing, MS in Data Science.
courses.engineering: Engineering programs: Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering.

fees.tuition: Tuition fees per semester: In-state undergraduate: $5,000, Out-state undergraduate: $12,000, Graduate programs: $8,000-$15,000 depending on program.
fees.application: Application fee: $50 for domestic students, $75 for international students. Fee waivers available for eligible students.
fees.financial_aid: Financial aid options: Merit-based scholarships, Need-based grants, Work-study programs, Student loans. FAFSA required for US students.
